sentences.en: Ability to maintain good co - ordination while serving orders quickly.
sentences.cn: 在服务过程中和同事保持良好的协调合作.

sentences.en: Better communications also favour information - sharing and co - ordination between agencies.
sentences.cn: 良好的通讯也有助各机构之间的信息共享和协调.

sentences.en: Co - ordination and mutual help between factories has become the order of the day.
sentences.cn: 厂际协作和互相帮助已蔚然成风.

sentences.en: Co - ordination of and Connection Between the Legal and Illegal Struggle.
sentences.cn: 六、合法斗争与非法斗争的配合与联系.

sentences.en: Concrete way by the co - ordination in accordance with actual local conditions determined.
sentences.cn: 具体方式由统筹地区根据本地实际情况确定.

sentences.en: For him the Church's decision to allow the ordination of women had been the last straw.
sentences.cn: 教会同意授给女性神职的决定使他终于忍无可忍。

sentences.en: Have strong management capabilities, good communication and co - ordination and decision - making capacity.
sentences.cn: 具有较强的管理能力, 良好的沟通协调和决策能力.

sentences.en: His ordination gives him the right to conduct a marriage or a funeral.
sentences.cn: 他的晋升圣职使他有权主持婚礼或葬礼.

sentences.en: Some degree of divergence is inevitable, but more co - ordination is needed.
sentences.cn: 一些分歧不可避免, 但还需要更多的协调.

sentences.en: Strong competency of management and good communication and co - ordination skill.
sentences.cn: 有强的管理,良好沟通和协调技巧能力.

sentences.en: Strong competency of organized, management and good communication and co - ordination skill.
sentences.cn: 具备很强的组织 、 管理能力、沟通和协调能力.

sentences.en: There are other reasons for pessimism about quickly achieving effective global co - ordination.
sentences.cn: 还有其他理由对有效全球协作的快速实现感到悲观.

sentences.en: This fitness equipment makes improvements in co - ordination and balance and connective tissue.
sentences.cn: 这种魔力健身棒在协调和平衡和结缔组织起到很好的促进作用.

sentences.en: This is what co - ordination and link among these four forces mean.
sentences.cn: 这就是这几种力量的配合与联系.

words.tran_cn: [生物]分类；任命；神职授任；排成等级

trans.tran_cn: [宗]圣职授任，任命，分类，排成等级
trans.tran_en: When someone's ordination takes place, they are made a minister, priest, or rabbi
